Founded by three Indians, Baskar Subramanian, KA Srinivasan and Srividhya Srinivasan, Amagi has raised over $245 million to date. It had raised $100 million around six months ago.

175.title: Want to live your best life? Make it happen: Godrej Park Retreat
175.article_body: Spread across 13 acres, Godrej Park Retreat offers 1, 2 and 3 BHK apartments in Sarjapur Road, Bangalore. Godrej Properties revealed that the township is situated close to the best hospitals, educational institutions, hotels, recreation centres and many large tech parks. Godrej Park Retreat has a clubhouse, 50+ amenities and 4.06 acres of greens.

176.title: Karan, Ananya & Manish attend Shweta Bachchan's b'day party, pics surface
176.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's daughter, Shweta Bachchan, celebrated her 48th birthday on Wednesday. Several Bollywood celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, Karan Johar, Ananya Panday, Manish Malhotra, Sidharth Malhotra and Shanaya Kapoor attended the party. As pictures surfaced online, Shweta seemingly kept white as the colour theme for her guests' outfits.

177.title: Ill-fated van was bought days ago: Mother of Indian student killed in Canada
177.article_body: Mother of 24-year-old Harpreet Singh, who was one of the five Indian students killed in a road mishap in Canada, said that the "ill-fated van had been purchased merely a few days ago". "For the last two years, he had been working as a driver on a work permit. He had been driving students from Brampton to Montreal," she added.

178.title: Only 60 aged 12-15 yrs get vaccinated in Pune as CoWIN glitch halts process
178.article_body: Only 60 children aged between 12 to 15 years could get vaccinated on first day of vaccination process for them in Pune. The Pune Municipal Corporation had set up 29 centres for vaccination of the age group. However, no registrations could be done due to glitch in the CoWin website. The website reportedly only started working post-lunch hours.

179.title: Govt to implement ₹7,500-cr scheme to tackle road mishaps: Nitin Gadkari
179.article_body: The Centre said it is planning to partner with the World Bank to implement a ₹7,500-crore scheme to reduce accident-prone areas and black spots on national and state highways, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said. India doesn't have a good record on road accident front and registers the world’s highest deaths due to it at 1.5 lakh every year, Gadkari added.

180.title: Over 2 lakh kids in 12-14 age group given COVID vaccine doses on Day 1
180.article_body: As many as 2,60,136 kids aged 12-14 were given COVID-19 vaccine doses on the first day as vaccination for 12-14 age group started on Wednesday, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. More than 2.15 crore precaution doses for identified categories of beneficiaries (HCWs, FLWs and over 60 years) for COVID-19 vaccination have been administered so far, the Ministry added.

181.title: Who voted for and who voted against Russia at ICJ over Ukraine invasion?
181.article_body: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) asked Russia to immediately halt its invasion of Ukraine in a 13-2 decision. Out of the 15 judges at the ICJ, judges from USA, Slovakia, France, Morocco, Somalia, Uganda, India, Jamaica, Lebanon, Japan, Germany, Australia and Judge ad hoc  Yves Daudet voted against Russia. Judges from Russia and China voted for Russia.

182.title: BJP MLA demands separate state of North Bengal in WB Assembly
182.article_body: BJP MLA from Darjeeling's Kurseong, Bishnu Prasad Sharma, on Wednesday demanded a separate state of North Bengal in the West Bengal Assembly. "The hills have been deprived for a very long time. Various communities...such as Gorkhas, Rajbanshis, Adivasis have been deprived," Sharma added. "We want North Bengal to be a separate state so that our problems are addressed," he stated.

183.title: Only 101 children turn up for vaccination in Chandigarh Tricity on Day 1
183.article_body: The COVID-19 vaccination drive for children aged 12-14 years which kicked off on Wednesday, opened to a poor response in Chandigarh Tricity with only 101 kids showing up to get the jab. The first dose of the Corbevax vaccine was administered to four, 37 and 60 children in Mohali, Chandigarh and Panchkula respectively on the first day.

184.title: Who is Miss World 2021 winner Karolina Bielawska?
184.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska, who has been crowned Miss World 2021, is currently studying for a Master's Degree in Management and would like to continue her studies with a PhD. She also works as a model and hopes to become a motivational speaker. "She enjoys swimming and scuba diving and playing tennis and badminton," read a post by Miss World organisation.

185.title: Deepfake video shows Zelenskyy telling Ukrainians to surrender; he calls it 'childish'
185.article_body: A video purportedly showing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calling on his country's forces to lay down arms is a "deepfake", Meta said, removing the video from Facebook. Zelenskyy also rebutted the video, calling it a "childish provocation". "I only advise that the troops of the Russian Federation lay down their arms and return home," he said.

186.title: Who is Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at ICJ?
186.article_body: Justice Dalveer Bhandari, the Indian judge who voted against Russia at the International Court of Justice, was born in Jodhpur. Bhandari practised at the Rajasthan High Court from 1968 to 1970 and then went to US on an international scholarship to pursue a Master of Laws degree. He also served as a senior judge of the Supreme Court of India.

187.title: Military operation in Ukraine developing successfully: Putin
187.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that the military operation in Ukraine was developing successfully. "The operation is developing successfully and in strict accordance with plans," he said. Asserting that Russia had no other option than to send troops, he added, "We will not allow Ukraine to serve as a springboard for aggressive actions against Russia."

188.title: I'm practising hard, not thinking too much about Team India call-up: Dhawan
188.article_body: Team India batter Shikhar Dhawan, who'll feature for PBKS in the upcoming IPL season, has said he's practising hard and not thinking too much about the Team India call-up. "If it doesn't happen then [also] I'm happy and without tension," he stated. Dhawan's appearance has been limited to ODIs since he was dropped from India's 2021 T20I World Cup squad.

189.title: Got fired for reviewing Tesla's FSD tech on YouTube: Ex-US employee
189.article_body: A former US Tesla employee John Bernal has claimed he was fired after he posted reviews on Tesla's driverless tech on his YouTube channel. He said his YouTube channel was cited as the reason for his dismissal. Bernal said Tesla also cut off his access to the FSD Beta system in the vehicle he personally owns.

190.title: Labourer kills co-worker, dumps body on river bank in Pune; arrested
190.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 36-year-old labourer for killing a co-worker and dumping his body on the banks of Mula river. "One of them had sold a phone to the other and payment was pending. A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

191.title: India reports 2,539 new COVID-19 cases, 60 deaths; active cases at 30,799
191.article_body: India has reported 2,539 new COVID-19 cases and 60 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 60 deaths, 22 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 38 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,132, and the active cases declined to 30,799.

192.title: What was the answer that won Poland's Karolina Bielawska the Miss World 2021 crown?
192.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was asked, "What's the most important discovery yet to be discovered?" "We all have unique experiences and all of us can learn something about ourselves...It costs us so little to enrich others' lives," she said. "If you'd like to discover something new, try to learn to be rich in more empathy, in compassion, in gratitude," Karolina added.

193.title: I wouldn't change too much, but catches could've made the difference: Cummins
193.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has said he wouldn't change too much in terms of their tactics in the second Test against Pakistan, which ended in a draw after Pakistan managed to save three wickets. He, however, also admitted that missed catches in the second innings could've made the difference. Australia missed at least four catches in Pakistan's second innings.

194.title: Girls who questioned hijab verdict are members of terror body: BJP leader
194.article_body: BJP leader Yashpal Suvarna, who is also Vice-President of Udupi Government PU College Development Committee, on Wednesday said that the girls who questioned Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban are "anti-national" and "members of a terrorist organisation". "The girls have proved once again that they are not students but members of a terrorist organisation," he said.

195.title: PM & govt must rise above petty politics, propaganda films: Owaisi
195.article_body: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Narendra Modi and the Centre must rise above their "petty politics" and "propaganda films", criticising Union Minister Rajnath Singh's statement concerning the accidental missile-firing which landed in Pakistan. Citing a report claiming, India's accidental missile-firing prompted Pakistan to prepare a retaliatory strike, Owaisi said Singh's statement told nothing.

196.title: 19-yr-old girl steals ₹8 lakh from home, elopes with man in Zirakpur
196.article_body: A 19-year-old girl and her 22-year-old boyfriend were booked by police after the girl stole ₹8 lakh from her home and eloped with the man. The girl's family alleged the man instigated their daughter into stealing the money after luring her with marriage. She went missing on February 28. Her parents found she eloped with her boyfriend through her friends.

197.title: All truth-seekers should watch 'The Kashmir Files': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
197.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that all the truth-seekers should watch the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. His remarks came after meeting the movie's director Vivek Agnihotri and actress Pallavi Joshi in New Delhi. "A brilliantly written script, a complete artistic work and a thorough research," Bhagwat said. The movie was released in theatres on March 11.

198.title: Don’t Memorise acquired by Infinity Learn
198.article_body: Infinity Learn by Sri Chaitanya announced acquisition of Don't Memorise, a multilingual YouTube content platform, founded by Ganesh Pai. Ujjwal Singh, CEO of Infinity Learn, said he welcomes 2.5 million users to its family with open arms. Ganesh calls this acquisition a golden opportunity to develop more K-10 learning solutions and scale their YouTube channel even more.

199.title: Don't want anyone to reduce my achievements: Vidya on not working with husband
199.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, who's married to producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, said they decided not to work together after their 2013 film 'Ghanchakkar'. "I don't want anyone to reduce my achievements to saying this happened for you because of your husband," she added. "One has worked...hard to get here and...I don't want that to happen for either of us," Vidya said.

200.title: Bappi Lahiri's daughter breaks down as his grandson sings late singer's song
200.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's daughter Rema Lahiri broke down at an event when her son Swastik Bansal sang one of the late singer's songs at an event recently. In his tribute, Swastik sang 'Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna' which was composed by Bappi Lahiri and sung by Kishore Kumar. Swastik also broke down towards the end of his performance.

201.title: Doing our best to ensure production at Shanghai plant: Tesla
201.article_body: Tesla has said it is doing its best to keep production going at its Shanghai factory amid China's COVID-19 prevention measures. This comes after a Reuters report said the firm had suspended production at the plant for two days. "We are actively cooperating with the government's requirements for nucleic acid testing and other epidemic prevention requirements," Tesla said.

202.title: Pune's double-decker flyover opened for public, to reduce traffic congestion
202.article_body: Pune's double-decker Nal Stop flyover has been opened for public use. It will help in reduction of traffic congestion on Karve Road in the city. "At Nal Stop, 35,000 to 40,000 vehicles pass every hour during peak hours, so it's important to have a flyover on this stretch," Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol had earlier said.

203.title: Liquor shops closed for 2 days in Hyd's Rachakonda ahead of Holi
203.article_body: Liquor shops will remain closed for two days from 6 pm on Thursday to 6 am on Saturday within Rachakonda Commissionerate limits ahead of Holi, police said. Wine shops, toddy shops and bars attached to restaurants, excluding those attached to star hotels and clubs, would be closed, police added. Groups moving aimlessly on their vehicles are prohibited, police stated.

204.title: 'The Kashmir Files' didn't show complete truth, only violence: C'garh CM
204.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files' with several MLAs on Wednesday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that the film did not show the complete truth and the makers only tried to highlight violence. "The film did not have any message. No attempt to offer any solution was made. I don't believe such a film has any relevance," said Baghel.

205.title: Bengaluru police arrest interstate car thief; recover SUVs worth ₹4 crore
205.article_body: Bengaluru police arrested a car thief who allegedly orchestrated at least 21 thefts in Bengaluru, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and Telangana. Police have recovered SUVs worth ₹4 crore from the accused, who has reportedly been involved in car thefts since 2003. "Accused used hacking devices and key-making machines to unlock high-end cars," Bengaluru City DCP (North East Division) Anoop Shetty said.

206.title: Poland's Karolina Bielawska crowned Miss World 2021, India's Manasa reaches semi-final
206.article_body: Poland's Karolina Bielawska was crowned Miss World 2021 by Jamaica's Toni-Ann Singh, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. US' Shree Saini was named first runner-up while Olivia Yace from Cote d'Ivoire was named second runner-up. Manasa Varanasi, who represented India, was among the semi-finalists. The event was earlier scheduled to take place in December 2021, but was postponed due to COVID-19.

207.title: Joe Biden calls Putin 'war criminal', Russia says it's 'unacceptable'
207.article_body: US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" for the first time, after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the US Congress. He also offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine that includes armed drones. Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the comments made by Biden were "unforgivable rhetoric" and "unacceptable", as per state-run TASS.

208.title: US woman abused online after being mistaken for Russian Foreign Minister's daughter
208.article_body: A US realtor has been abused online by people mistaking her for daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov amid the war in Ukraine. Ekaterina Lavrova said, "People wish you to burn in hell, you know, 'you should be deported,' 'let's take over her apartment and host somebody from Ukraine.'" Lavrov's daughter shares the same name as the US realtor.

209.title: Sharapova, Schumacher booked for fraud for promoting Gurugram real estate project
209.article_body: Gurugram Police have booked former Russian tennis star Maria Sharapova and former Formula 1 racer Michael Schumacher for fraud and criminal conspiracy. Delhi's Shafali Agarwal complained she booked an apartment in a project named after Sharapova and was cheated of nearly ₹80 lakh. Agarwal complained Sharapova made false promises, had dinner parties with buyers but the project never took off.

210.title: Actress Park Ha-sun contributes to emergency relief in Ukraine
210.article_body: South Korean actress Park Ha-sun contributed to an emergency relief campaign to help Ukraine, her agency reportedly said. It added that the donation will be used to "purchase food and daily necessities for Ukrainian children and residents suffering from the war". She reportedly donated 10 million won (over ₹6 lakh) to NGO 'Korea Food for the Hungry International' (KFHI).

211.title: Went through depression, he was the only one who didn't leave: Shama on James
211.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who recently got married to American businessman James Milliron said that he did not leave her during her phase of depression. "I would get depressed...I did not want anybody around me...I would push them to go away...everybody would leave...he was the only one who did not leave," she said. "James said 'Sorry, I can't leave'," she added.

212.title: India's judge votes against Russia over Ukraine invasion at International Court of Justice
212.article_body: India's judge at International Court of Justice, Justice Dalveer Bhandari, voted against Russia as the UN's top court asked Russia to immediately stop its invasion of Ukraine. Thirteen judges voted against Russia, while two judges voted in favour of Russia. Earlier, India had abstained from voting on the Ukraine-Russia issue at the UN Security Council and UN General Assembly.

213.title: 3,837 kids vaccinated in Delhi on Day 1 of vaccination for 12-14 yrs old
213.article_body: As many as 3,837 kids were vaccinated against COVID-19 in Delhi on Wednesday which was the first day of vaccination for those in the 12-14 age group. Northeast Delhi vaccinated the maximum number of children at 2,310, followed by North Delhi at 362. About six to seven lakh children in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccination in Delhi.

214.title: Philippines designer makes gowns, dresses out of recycled waste
214.article_body: A designer from Philippines has been making dresses out of waste materials like recycled newspapers, plastic wrapping and rice sacks using a foot-operated sewing machine. Seamstress Leonora Buenviaje said clothes made from such items are both economical and fashionable. Her frocks and gowns, which she weaves out of plastic, are sometimes used in beauty contests and pageants, Reuters reported.

215.title: Pune Police forms special squads to maintain vigil on Holi
215.article_body: The Pune Police has formed special squads at the police station level to maintain a vigil on anti-social elements during Holi celebrations. The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation Commissionerate has also formed around 10 such squads. Officials will patrol streets in civil clothes and police teams will be stationed in sensitive areas.

216.title: Delhi Traffic Police details measures to ensure safe Holi celebrations
216.article_body: Delhi Police Joint Commissioner (Traffic) Vivek Kishore said police personnel will be deployed on all major roads and intersections on the occasion of Holi (March 18). He also urged citizens to avoid traffic violations like drunken driving, overspeeding and triple-riding. Delhi's Food Safety Department has also directed officials to ensure adulterated food products are not sold during Holi.

217.title: Air purifiers to be installed at traffic intersections in Mumbai
217.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install air purifiers at traffic intersections to reduce the impact of carbon emissions in the city. BMC has identified 70 traffic junctions where these purifiers will likely be installed in the days to come, senior civic officials said. One purifier has already been set up at the Mahapalika Marg near BMC headquarters.

218.title: London's V&A museum holds its first male fashion exhibition
218.article_body: London's V&A museum is holding its first exhibition dedicated to men's fashion. The 'Fashioning Masculinities: The Art of Menswear' exhibition would display menswear from centuries, including the 18th century to the present date, while shining light on designers, tailors and artists. "The approach to...show was to look at both fashion and art," senior curator of fashion Claire Wilcox said.

219.title: To oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress: Rebel leaders
219.article_body: After meeting post Congress' loss in recent Assembly polls, party's G-23 leaders said in order to oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress. The leaders demanded Congress to initiate dialogue with like-minded forces to create way for credible alternative for 2024 general elections. They added that only way forward for Congress is to adopt model of collective and inclusive leadership.

220.title: Only shows requesting position of Russian side: Ukraine on report of tentative peace plan
220.article_body: After Financial Times said Ukraine, Russia have drawn up tentative peace plan to end war, Ukraine's presidential adviser Mikhail Podolyak tweeted, "FT published a draft, which represents requesting position of...Russian side. Nothing more." "Ukrainian side has its own positions. Only thing we confirm...is ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops and security guarantees from...countries," he said.

221.title: Germany records 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
221.article_body: Germany's Robert Koch Institute (RKI) on Wednesday reported 2,62,593 new COVID-19 cases. The country's seven-day incidence rate rose to a record 1,607 infections per 1,00,000 people for the first time over the past week. The RKI also reported 269 COVID-19 related deaths, raising the total death toll in Germany since the pandemic began to 1,26,142.

222.title: Barcelona sign shirt, stadium sponsorship deal with Spotify
222.article_body: Barcelona on Tuesday said it signed a shirt and stadium sponsorship deal with audio streaming site Spotify. The brand's name will appear on the front of the men's and women's team shirts for four years from the 2022/23 campaign onwards. The club's stadium will also be renamed to Spotify Camp Nou. The deal is reportedly worth over $300 million.

223.title: Anything can happen: Red Bull’s Verstappen ahead of Bahrain Grand Prix
223.article_body: Red Bull's Formula One world champion Max Verstappen believes that "anything can happen" ahead of the Bahrain Grand Prix on March 20. "The car looks good and as a team, we are in a good place," the 24-year-old said. "I'm looking forward to seeing where we are compared to the rest of the grid come qualifying on Saturday," he added.

224.title: Coming from a broken home, music was the only avenue I had: Shruti
224.article_body: Actress and musician Shruti Haasan in an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla shared her experience with music. "Coming from a broken home, and not having a way to express myself, music was the only avenue I had," the 36-year-old said on music being everything for her. She revealed she sang English numbers at a restaurant in Mumbai when nobody knew her.

225.title: I am going to relax, watch a movie: Pooja Hegde on her Holi plans
225.article_body: In an exclusive conversation with Pinkvilla recently, actress Pooja Hegde opened up about her plans for Holi and said she's "going to relax and watch a movie". While sharing her childhood memories of the festival, she added, "Now as an actor, I...don't have the liberty of playing Holi because I am always shooting something...I don't want to take the risk.

226.title: Russia accuses Bangladeshi media of 'biased' coverage on Ukraine war
226.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to Bangladesh, Alexander Mantytskiy, has written an open letter to Bangladeshi media outlets, accusing them of "biased" reportage on Ukraine invasion. Mantytskiy stated that the media outlets were following "anti-Russian propaganda", motivated by "prejudice". Reacting to it, a Bangladeshi news editor said that a foreign ambassador shouldn't tell journalists how to do their job.

227.title: Cong appoints leaders to assess situation after loss in 5 states
227.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday appointed senior leaders Jairam Ramesh, Ajay Maken, Jitendra Singh, Rajani Patil and Avinash Pandey to assess the post-poll situation and suggest organisational changes. This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states. Sonia had on Tuesday asked the party's state unit chiefs in these states to resign.

228.title: K'taka ACB raids 18 govt officials; gold necklaces, cars recovered
228.article_body: The Karnataka Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Wednesday conducted raids against 18 officers regarding disproportionate asset cases and started searches at 75 places across the state. ACB seized three cars, eight gold necklaces from Bengaluru's Traffic Safety Department's Additional Commissioner Gnanendra Kumar. ACB seized a bungalow belonging to engineer Ashok Reddy of Krishna Bhagya Jala Nigam.

229.title: Ukraine captures hacker who was allegedly helping Russian troops
229.article_body: The Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) has captured a hacker that the country claims was helping the Russian troops with mobile communications in Ukraine. According to SBU, the hacker was allegedly helping to route calls from within Russia to the mobile phones of Russian troops in Ukraine. The hacker was also sending text messages to Ukrainian officers proposing they surrender.

230.title: Jharkhand break world record for taking highest-ever lead in a first-class match
230.article_body: Jharkhand have broken the world record for taking the highest-ever lead in a first-class match. Jharkhand took a total lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland in their Ranji Trophy 2021-22 pre-quarterfinal. Jharkhand were bowled out for 880 in their first innings before dismissing Nagaland for 289. Jharkhand scored 417/6 in their second innings as the match ended in a draw.

231.title: They made me feel ugly: Vidya on producers replacing her in films
231.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan in a recent interview shared how producers replaced her in over a dozen films and behaved very badly with her. "They made me feel so ugly that for six months, I couldn't...look at myself in the mirror," she said. The 43-year-old recalled how during one such rejection she walked for hours and "cried a lot".

232.title: Record 4,00,000 new COVID-19 cases recorded in South Korea in 24 hours
232.article_body: South Korea reported a record 4,00,741 new daily COVID-19 cases, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Wednesday. According to the Associated Press, South Korea saw its deadliest day yet of the pandemic on Tuesday, with 293 deaths. South Korea is currently grappling with a record surge in coronavirus infections driven by the fast-moving omicron variant.

233.title: Pics show India's first rapid rail; can cover Delhi-Meerut distance in 55 minutes
233.article_body: The first look of India's first rapid rail, which will run on the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut corridor and cover a distance of 82 km in just 55 minutes, has been unveiled by National Capital Regional Transport Corporation. The upcoming RRTS trains will reportedly have 2×2 transverse seating, overhead luggage racks, CCTV cameras, sockets at every seat for laptop/mobile charging among other amenities.

234.title: Was asked to praise mediocre contestants: Sonu on Hindi reality shows
234.article_body: Singer Sonu Nigam has said that he has turned down several Hindi reality shows because he's tired of being asked to praise contestants even when the song isn't good. "I don't like that...I don't look forward to earning money and I don't see the necessity of being a part of a show just for the sake of it," he added.

235.title: The Kashmir Files used to divert attention from issues: Raj minister
235.article_body: Rajasthan Food and Civil Supplies Minister Pratap Khachariyawas on Wednesday said BJP is using 'The Kashmir Files' to divert people's attention from issues like inflation and unemployment. He blamed BJP for the exodus of Kashmiri pandits, saying it was their government at the Centre when it took place. "The Congress has fought against terrorism and always opposed it," he said.

236.title: ICC Prosecutor holds virtual meeting with Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
236.article_body: The International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan on Wednesday held a virtual meeting with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during his visit to Ukraine. "I was pleased to hold important exchanges with the president while in the country," Khan said. Both agreed that all efforts were necessary to "ensure international humanitarian law is respected".

237.title: If Kashmir Files can be made, Lakhimpur Files can be made too: Akhilesh
237.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said if the movie The Kashmir Files can be made on Kashmir, then Lakhimpur Files can also be made. In October 2021, a car belonging to the son of the Minister of State for Home Affairs, Ajay Mishra allegedly ran over farmers, who were protesting against farm laws in Lakhimpur Kheri.

238.title: How does 2022 Women's World Cup points table read after India's 2nd defeat?
238.article_body: After suffering their second defeat in 2022 Women's World Cup, India are now on the third position on the points table with four points from four matches. Australia are on top of the table with four wins in four matches. Pakistan, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are last on the table.

239.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic free to play French Open 2022 as things stand, say organisers
239.article_body: Unvaccinated players, including Novak Djokovic, will be free to play at French Open 2022 as things stand, the French Tennis Federation (FFT) said on Wednesday.  "Our goal is to have the best possible entry list," tournament director Amelie Mauresmo said. Djokovic was not allowed to play Australian Open due to his COVID-19 vaccination status.

240.title: My mother supported me despite health & financial problems: Shantanu
240.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari said that his mother supported his talent of dancing despite having health and financial issues. "She did whatever she could do in Calcutta to make sure...I'm participating in all the competitions, I'm being visible in the shows where named artists are coming," he stated. Shantanu added that he started performing for money to support his family financially.

241.title: Russia suffering heavy losses in Ukraine: UK's Ministry of Defence
241.article_body: The UK's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Russia has suffered "heavy losses" as they continue to face "sustained" Ukrainian resistance, adding it's likely the casualty toll is making it difficult to launch offensive operations. "Continued personnel losses will also make it difficult for Russia to secure occupied territory," it said. Around 5,000 Russian troops have reportedly been killed.

242.title: Japan to revoke Russia's 'Most Favoured Nation' status amid Ukraine war
242.article_body: Japan will revoke Russia's 'Most Favoured Nation' (MFN) status amid Ukraine invasion, PM Fumio Kishida has said. Japan will impose curbs on export of luxury items to Russia and ban import of goods from there, he added. The MFN status calls for World Trade Organization member countries to treat each other equally with respect to few trade barriers, low tariffs.

243.title: Russia-Ukraine war is a massively destabilising event: Zuckerberg
243.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday said the Russia-Ukraine war is a "massively destabilising world event". "It's really tough to find the right words that really mean anything in a situation like this," he said. Meta is working to continue running its services in the region so that Ukrainians can continue using them, Zuckerberg added.

244.title: Ola Electric appoints ex-LG Chem Power CEO Prabhakar Patil to board
244.article_body: Former LG Chem Power CEO Prabhakar Patil has been appointed to the board of Ola Electric, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said on Wednesday. "We'll set up a cutting edge cell manufacturing facility with up to 50GWh capacity...in India. Dr Prabhakar's expertise will help the company accelerate this process of bringing indigenously designed and manufactured cells to the market," Aggarwal said.

245.title: Congress' G-23 leaders meet after party's poor performance in polls
245.article_body: A group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, met at senior leader Ghulam Nabi Azad's residence, days after the party performed poorly in five Assembly elections. Those who reportedly attended the meeting were Kapil Sibal, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Mani Shankar Aiyar and Shashi Tharoor. The leaders met amid calls for a change in Congress' leadership.

246.title: Ryan's so instantaneous with responses of lines, it's inspiring: Zoe
246.article_body: Actress Zoe Saldana, speaking about working with Ryan Reynolds in 'The Adam Project', has said, "He's witty, but when you get to meet him, he's so down to earth." She further revealed that Ryan writes his material and added, "He's just so instantaneous with the responses of lines and things like that. It's inspiring to witness that."

247.title: No plan to privatise Indian Railways, no ban on recruitment: Minister
247.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Wednesday said the government has no plans to privatise the Indian Railways and that there's no ban on recruitment. "The track belongs to railways, stations belong to railways, engines belong to railways, trains belong to railways, signalling systems belong to railways," he said. He further added that recruitment is going on for 1.14 lakh vacancies.

248.title: College student dies by suicide in MP; note recovered
248.article_body: A private college student allegedly died by suicide by jumping off a building in MP's Indore. The second-year BCom student, identified as Rajani Nilore, also left a handwritten suicide note. The incident is said to have taken place in the Banganga locality of the city, police said on Wednesday.

249.title: Allow Ukraine returned students to intern in govt colleges: WB CM
249.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi to provide suggestions to accommodate and allow Ukraine returned students to intern in government medical colleges. She has asked that students in "different years of studies" be accommodated "at an equivalent level in private medical colleges" and for colleges to increase the number of seats.

250.title: JDU leader's grandson shot dead in road robbery bid in Bihar
250.article_body: The grandson of a senior leader of Janata Dal United (JDU) was shot dead in Bihar's Chapra city as he resisted a robbery bid. The incident happened on Wednesday when JDU leader Baijnath Prasad Bikal's grandson Dipak Kumar was travelling on a motorbike. Many villagers assembled at the scene and blocked the road for three hours following the incident.

251.title: 15 people missing after landslide buries at least 60 homes in Peru
251.article_body: Eight people have been rescued and at least 15 are missing after a major landslide in Peru's La Libertad region, the government said on Wednesday. The landslide, which occurred on Tuesday, has left around 60 to 80 homes buried underground, according to local authorities. Meanwhile, the National Civil Defense Institute said the landslide was the result of heavy rains.

252.title: MP clinic's doctor accused of chopping off employee's private part
252.article_body: A doctor at a dental clinic in MP's Sidhi district has been accused of chopping off an employee's private part. A case was, however, registered against the employee after the doctor and clinic-owner, who was also found injured, lodged a complaint about the employee first. Police said further action would be taken after results of the employee's medical report.

253.title: Gandhi family Cong's best leadership option during crisis: Khurshid
253.article_body: Amid growing dissent within the Congress, party leader Salman Khurshid said that the Gandhi family is the party's best possible leadership option in this "moment of crisis". Khurshid further said that the party leaders want Rahul Gandhi to take over as full-time Congress president. "I hope he does so after internal polls," he said.

254.title: Navi Mumbai police sub-inspector held for accepting ₹10,000 bribe
254.article_body: A police sub-inspector in Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra, has been arrested for allegedly accepting ₹10,000 as bribe. The policeman, identified as 29-year-old Sagar Pawar, had reportedly demanded ₹20,000 initially to help the complainant, who had a case of molestation registered against him. Pawar allegedly threatened to make his case strong if he didn't give him the bribe.

255.title: Mumbai's ANC seizes 32 kg marijuana worth ₹8 lakhs; 2 arrested
255.article_body: The Anti-Narcotic Cell of the Mumbai crime branch has arrested two people and seized 32 kilograms of marijuana worth ₹8 lakhs from them. Police found them walking suspiciously and intervened to find 17 kg of marijuana worth ₹4.25 lakhs with one person and 15 kilograms of marijuana worth ₹3.75 lakhs with the other, said DCP (ANC) Datta Nalawade.

256.title: 3 dead, 3 critically ill after consuming spurious alcohol in Bengal
256.article_body: At least three people have died after consuming spurious alcohol in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district, police said on Wednesday. Three others, who were reported to be critically ill, were admitted to a hospital in Baruipur for treatment, Baruipur SP said. The accused had mistaken formalin pesticide for water and mixed it with alcohol, reports stated.

257.title: Russia ordered to immediately stop Ukraine invasion by International Court of Justice
257.article_body: The UN's highest court, the International Court of Justice (ICJ), on Wednesday ordered Russia to immediately stop invasion of Ukraine. "The order is binding under international law. Russia must comply immediately. Ignoring the order will isolate Russia even further," tweeted Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "Ukraine gained a complete victory in its case against Russia at the ICJ," he wrote.

258.title: Jamia Millia Islamia professor arrested for accepting ₹1 lakh bribe
258.article_body: The CBI has arrested a professor of Jamia Millia Islamia's civil engineering department for accepting a bribe of ₹1 lakh from a Delhi-based architecture firm, officials said on Wednesday. His two more associates were also arrested. The professor had allegedly given the structural safety certificate to Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso apartment, a part of which collapsed recently and two women died.

259.title: Will use salary for orphan girls' weddings & poor kids: U'khand MLA Umesh
259.article_body: Umesh Kumar, the newly-elected MLA from Khanpur in Uttarakhand, said on Tuesday that he will use his salary for the weddings of orphan girls and to help poor children. "Not a single rupee will be spent on personal expenses," he tweeted. Kumar, whose sting operation in 2016 against former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat gained attention, fought as an independent candidate.

260.title: Russian tech entrepreneurs to launch 'Rossgram' app after Instagram banned
260.article_body: Russian technology entrepreneurs are set to launch a photo-sharing app named 'Rossgram' in the domestic market after Russia banned Instagram. The app will launch on March 28 and have additional functions such as crowdfunding and paid access for some content. According to a photo shared by the entrepreneurs, Rossgram's colour scheme and layout will bear a strong resemblance to Instagram.

261.title: Brothers aged 8 & 6 found a month after getting lost in Amazon forest
261.article_body: Two brothers aged eight and six have been found alive almost a month after they got lost in Amazon rainforest in the Brazilian state of Amazonas. Pictures of the boys after their rescue showed them malnourished and extremely thin. They were spotted by a man cutting wood in the forest on Tuesday after police called off search for the children.

262.title: 2 million households lose power as 7.3 magnitude earthquake hits Japan
262.article_body: At least two million households were left without power, including 7,00,000 in Tokyo, electricity provider TEPCO said, after a 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit Japan. In the northeastern region, 1,56,000 households had no power, regional energy company Tohoku Electric Power said. Authorities have warned residents in Fukushima, Miyagi and Yamagata prefectures to expect aftershocks.

263.title: I’m focused on being the healthiest I can be: Hamilton on new F1 season
263.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he is focusing on being the healthiest he can be ahead of the new F1 season. "So, I think today, I feel the healthiest, the fittest I've ever been," he said. The new F1 season begins in Bahrain on March 20. Hamilton will feature for Mercedes alongside new teammate George Russell.

264.title: McLaren’s Ricciardo set to feature in Bahrain after -ve COVID-19 test
264.article_body: McLaren on Wednesday said driver Daniel Ricciardo has tested negative for COVID-19 and will return on Thursday ahead of the Formula One 2022 season opener in Bahrain on March 20. "Daniel has been feeling better each day as he continued to recover while in isolation following local regulations in Bahrain," McLaren said. Ricciardo tested positive for COVID-19 on March 11.

265.title: It's another tough moment for us: De Gea on Man Utd's CL exit
265.article_body: Manchester United goalkeeper David De Gea said the club's exit from Champions League after losing 1-2 on aggregate to Atletico Madrid was "another tough moment for us". United will end a fifth consecutive campaign without a trophy since winning the Europa League in 2017. "There are too many years without any trophies, even without fighting for trophies," he said.

266.title: Need to change the way women are portrayed in TV shows: Archana
266.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh said that there's a need for a big change in the content and the way women are portrayed on television. Recalling her 1980s show 'Mr Ya Mrs', she said, "Women were shown to step out, work and earn for the family." "Currently, TV shows portray how the woman is always crying...always sacrificing her needs," Archana added.

267.title: Women tie up rape accused to tree, lynch him in Tripura's Dhalai
267.article_body: A 46-year-old rape accused was tied to a tree and lynched by a group of women in Tripura's Dhalai district on Wednesday, police said. The man had allegedly raped a five-year-old girl in a jungle on Tuesday night, who was later rescued by locals. The accused, who was beaten up the next day, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital.

268.title: Tip of the iceberg: WHO as number of COVID-19 cases rises again in countries
268.article_body: Amid global rise in COVID-19 cases, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said, "These increases are occurring despite reductions in testing in some countries, which means the cases we're seeing are just the tip of the iceberg." He added there are "unacceptably high levels of mortality" in many countries as new infections jumped by 8% last week, compared to previous week.

269.title: Who are India's 10 richest people and what are their net worths as per Hurun?
269.article_body: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person and 9th-richest worldwide with $103 billion wealth, as per 2022 Hurun Global Rich List. Adani & family are 2nd-richest in India, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family, Serum Institute's Cyrus Poonawalla and ArcelorMittal's Lakshmi Mittal. DMart's Radhakishan Damani & family are 6th richest in India and SP Hinduja & family 7th richest.

270.title: Akhilesh shares clip of convoy running into bull, says, 'Journey in UP difficult'
270.article_body: Former UP CM and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a clip on Wednesday that showed his convoy running into a bull on the road. "You will meet bulls on your travels, keep going if you can. The journey is very difficult in UP, keep going if you can," Yadav wrote. His car slowed down to give way to the animal.

271.title: Tsunami warning issued after massive earthquake of 7.3 magnitude hits Japan
271.article_body: A 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit the coast of Fukushima in northern Japan on Wednesday evening, triggering a tsunami advisory. The Japan Meteorological Agency said it struck 60 kilometres below the sea. The region is part of northern Japan that was devastated by a deadly 9.0 quake and tsunami in 2011. There are no immediate reports of casualties or damage.

272.title: People wouldn't know truth if not for 'The Kashmir Files': Giriraj Singh
272.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh lauded movie 'The Kashmir Files', stating that people wouldn't come to know the truth if this film wasn’t made. Singh added that the film, which has been made tax-free in eight states, should be shown across all villages in India. Directed by Vivek Agnihotri, 'The Kashmir Files' depicts exodus of Kashmiri Pandit community from Kashmir valley.

273.title: Saudi crown prince meets UK PM Johnson in Riyadh, signs MoU
273.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman met United Kingdom PM Boris Johnson in Riyadh on Wednesday, Saudi press agency SPA reported. During the meeting, Saudi Arabia and the UK signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to establish a strategic partnership council, it reported. The leaders of the two nations also discussed bilateral cooperation and means to strengthen it.

274.title: Adani added ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021: Hurun
274.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani, who ranks 12th on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, added an average of ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021, Hurun said. With a net addition of $49 billion, Adani added the most amount of wealth among the world's billionaires. Adani & his family's total wealth is estimated at $81 billion.

275.title: Russia has turned Ukrainian sky into a source of death: Ukraine Prez
275.article_body: Addressing the US Congress on Wednesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Russia has turned...Ukrainian sky into a source of death for thousands of people." He said, "Russia has attacked not just us...it went on...brutal offensive against our values [and] against our right to live freely in our...country." He further urged the US Congress to do more to help the country.

276.title: Bhansali had called me for 'Saawariya' but I was in rehab: Prateik
276.article_body: Prateik Babbar revealed that filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali had called his house to cast him in 'Saawariya' when he was 18 years old. "I was too young...was in rehab so it couldn't have worked out," he added. Prateik stated his grandparents told him about it a few years later. 'Saawariya' marked the Bollywood debut of Ranbir Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor.

277.title: Shafali can provide India something exceptional vs Australia: Hussain
277.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said India Women will need something "exceptional" to beat Australia in their upcoming 2022 Women's World Cup match, adding that opener Shafali Verma can make the difference. "You can't just prod along. You are going to need something above par. Shafali can provide that," stated Hussain. India Women will take on Australia on March 19.

278.title: Govt restores 5-yr e-tourist visas to156 nations after 2 yrs: Reports
278.article_body: Two years after suspending them over the COVID-19 outbreak, the government has restored valid five years e-tourist visas given to citizens of 156 countries, reports said on Wednesday. It restored regular paper visas given to nationals of all countries with immediate effect. Further, all currently valid 10 years regular tourist visas, given to US and Japan's citizens, have been restored.

279.title: Most men weren't willing to do a film where 60% was me: Kriti Sanon
279.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said that she's been in situations where most of the male actors weren't willing to be a part of the film where 60% was her role. "These things need to change a little," Kriti added. Talking about Akshay Kumar's small role in 'Atrangi Re', Kriti said, "Akshay is...not insecure of anyone, and plays his part honestly."

280.title: My family was shocked: Raashii Khanna on her performance in 'Rudra...'
280.article_body: Sharing her family's reaction to her performance in 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness', actress Raashii Khanna said, "My family and friends were shocked...They...never thought I could pull a character like this off." "I never thought I could pull it off," added Raashii. "I had always been looking for something that threw me out of my comfort zone," stated Raashii.

281.title: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy orders daily minute of silence for war victims
281.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has ordered a daily minute of silence for the victims of the Russian invasion. He said, "Every morning at 9 am we'll remember...Ukrainians who gave their lives." Zelenskyy said the initiative mourns both Ukrainian soldiers and civilians killed in the war, adding, "All of them who could still be alive if Russia hadn't started this war."

282.title: Every other team may make a big deal of Chahar's absence but not CSK: Vettori
282.article_body: Talking about Deepak Chahar, who may miss a few CSK matches in IPL 2022 due to a hamstring injury, Daniel Vettori said, "Every other team might make a big deal out of it but [not] CSK." "I think they are one of the few teams that can survive spending ₹14 crore on a player and just moving on," added Vettori.

283.title: Muslim cleric calls for K'taka bandh tomorrow against HC's hijab order
283.article_body: The Ameer-E-Shariat Karnataka, Maulana Sagir Ahmad Khan Rashadi, has asked the Muslim community to implement a day-long bandh on Thursday in Karnataka to protest against HC's order of upholding the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions. Saying that the protest will be peaceful, he added, "You shouldn't impose bandh by forcibly closing shops." He described the order as 'sad'.

284.title: New variant of COVID-19 detected in Israel
284.article_body: Israel's Ministry of Health has said that two cases of a new COVID-19 strain have been detected in the country. "Two cases of verified strains of a combined variety of varieties BA1 (Omicron) and BA2 were discovered in the State of Israel. This strain is not yet known in the world," it stated. It added that patients showed mild symptoms.

285.title: Pregnant Malaysian woman gifts husband ₹3cr Lamborghini over sleepless nights ahead
285.article_body: An expecting mother in Malaysia has bought her husband a Lamborghini Huracan Evo worth RM 2 million (over ₹3 crore) as a reward for the long, sleepless nights that await him once she gives birth. Anes Ayuni Osman, 19, is an entrepreneur who married in February 2021. She said she's scheduled to deliver her firstborn at the end of March.

286.title: Mukesh Ambani only Indian to enter the top 10 in Hurun Global Rich List 2022
286.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani is the only Indian to feature among the top 10 people on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. With a 24% y-o-y increase in wealth, Ambani was ranked 9th among the world's billionaires, with his wealth estimated at $103 billion. Gautam Adani & family ranked 12th globally, with their wealth estimated at $81 billion.

287.title: I'll do the film only if I'm not paid: Salman Khan reportedly told 'Godfather' makers
287.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was offered "a handsome amount" by the makers of Chiranjeevi-starrer upcoming film 'Godfather', but he didn't charge a single penny for his appearance, Pinkvilla reported. "Salman had put forth a clear condition – 'I will do the film, only if you don't pay me'," the report added. Salman loves and respects Chiranjeevi, the report said.

288.title: Chahal takes over RR's Twitter account, says 'Where are you my love Ashwin'
288.article_body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal took over Rajasthan Royals' Twitter account and jokingly tweeted, "Where are you my love @ashwinravi99. No calls, no texts...Is there anyone else in your life?" Chahal also shared a picture of himself and wrote, "Meet RR new captain." Further, sharing another picture, he joked, "10,000 retweets and he will open with Jos Buttler uncle."

289.title: It's a better time to be female actor than male actor: Vidya Balan
289.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan, in an interview, said it's a better time to be a female actor than being a male actor. "Variety in the way...roles are written is far more exciting than what's happening in the male actor's space," Vidya said. Adding to it, Shefali Shah stated that OTT platforms have given actresses a chance to explore, express, and experiment.

290.title: Starbucks CEO to step down, Founder Howard Schultz to return as interim CEO
290.article_body: Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson will step down from his role on April 4 and Founder Howard Schultz will take over as interim CEO, the company announced on Wednesday. "I feel this is a natural bookend to my 13 years with the company," Johnson said. He will continue in an advisory role to the company and its board through September.

291.title: Poland, Czech Republic & Slovenia PMs return after Kyiv visit
291.article_body: Prime Ministers of European Union (EU) member countries Poland, Slovenia and Czech Republic returned to Poland on Wednesday after visiting Kyiv, Polish government confirmed. The visit was aimed to be a gesture of solidarity towards Ukraine amid Russian invasion. The leaders were accompanied by Poland’s Deputy PM Jarosław Kaczyński, who has expressed need for a NATO peacekeeping mission in Ukraine.

292.title: Ajay Devgn in talks to play Tansen in Bhansali's Baiju Bawra: Report
292.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali reportedly wants Ajay Devgn to play Tansen in 'Baiju Bawra'. "Bhansali feels Devgn had a big hand in the success of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," a source stated. Talking about the role, the source said, "It's a role with shades of grey in it. But Ajay has never been afraid to go where others are afraid to."

293.title: Have to be born many times to repay this debt: Mann on becoming CM
293.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Bhagwant Mann was sworn in as the 18th Chief Minister of Punjab on Wednesday and said that he would have to be reborn several times to "repay this debt". Mann's swearing-in ceremony took place in Bhagat Singh's ancestral village in Punjab. AAP is fighting to turn Punjab into what Bhagat Singh had dreamt of, Mann added.

294.title: KT Rama Rao inaugurates Hyderabad's LB Nagar junction underpass
294.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday inaugurated an underpass bridge in LB Nagar junction and a flyover in Bairamalguda. LB Nagar is a major entry and exit point for people commuting from Hyderabad to Vijayawada, Warangal and Nalgonda. The Bairamalguda flyover is likely to decongest traffic from Shamshabad airport.

295.title: Momo vendor stabbed, strangled with a towel by thief in Delhi
295.article_body: A momo vendor was stabbed and strangled with a towel by a man who allegedly entered his room for theft in Delhi's Sadar Bazar, police said on Wednesday. The accused went to the building to steal, but found the victim sitting in his room, police said. He allegedly struck a conversation with him before strangling him, stole ₹8,260 and escaped.

296.title: 20-yr-old man beaten to death on suspicion of theft near Mumbai
296.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by a group of people on suspicion of theft near Mumbai, Maharashtra. Police said the incident took place on the intervening night of Tuesday and Wednesday in Thane's Bhiwandi. A case has been registered under section 302 (murder) of the IPC over the incident and local police are probing the case further.

297.title: Man travels to 254 Delhi Metro stations in 16 hrs, enters Guinness World Records
297.article_body: Prafull Singh, a Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) employee, has entered the Guinness World Records for recording the fastest time to travel to all Delhi Metro stations. Singh travelled to 254 stations in 16 hours 2 minutes and 17 seconds. "I've been using Delhi Metro for a long time so I'm very much aware of all the lines," Singh said.

298.title: 'Send Putin to Jupiter' fundraiser by Ukraine raises ₹16 crore
298.article_body: A Ukrainian government-backed 'Send Putin to Jupiter' fundraiser against Russian President Vladimir Putin has raised over $2,123,000 (₹16 crore) so far. "Donate to help us build a rocket that will send a bloody dictator far far away," the donation website states. The funds will be used to help armed forces of Ukraine and rebuild infrastructure, according to the website.

299.title: Volunteers from United Sikhs provide aid to Ukrainian refugees
299.article_body: Over a dozen volunteers from United Sikhs, a UN-affiliated human rights and advocacy group, have set up a camp in Medyka, Poland, near the Ukrainian border for nearly two weeks to provide humanitarian aid to refugees. United Sikhs said its humanitarian mission has served over 1,00,000 refugees by providing hot meals, water, clothes, sanitation kits and other daily necessities.

300.title: Japan to fully lift COVID-19 restrictions on Mar 21 as cases decline
300.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases in the country, Japan's PM Fumio Kishida on Wednesday announced plans to fully lift COVID-19 related restrictions on March 21. "This will be a transitional period so that we can return to our normal daily lives...by taking maximum precautions" Now, larger gatherings will be allowed for people with vaccination records and negative virus tests, he added.

301.title: New Zealand to reopen borders for tourism from May 1
301.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Wednesday said the country was "ready to welcome the world back" after announcing most tourists can travel from May 1. Vaccinated tourists from about 30 visa waiver countries like the US, UK, Canada and most of Europe can enter after providing a negative COVID-19 test before departing their country and again upon arrival.

302.title: Russia quits human rights watchdog Council of Europe
302.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said it has formally left the Council of Europe, the continent's leading human rights watchdog based in Strasbourg, France. Russia's membership was suspended by the body following its invasion of Ukraine. "We part with such a Council of Europe without regret," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Russia joined the Council of Europe in 1996.

303.title: Video shows Ukraine continuously firing towards Russian target in the dark
303.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Defence has posted a video on Twitter, showing continuous firing on the Russian forces. The footage, taken in dark, shows shots being fired by the Ukrainian military towards a target which is not visible. "Uninvited guests will not sleep peacefully on Ukrainian soil - our artillerymen greet them warmly everywhere," the Defence Ministry tweeted.

304.title: HC allows reopening of Nizamuddin Markaz's 4 floors, no cap on attendees
304.article_body: Two years after it was closed for violating COVID-19 norms at Tablighi Jamaat event, Delhi High Court on Wednesday allowed the reopening of four floors of Nizamuddin Markaz mosque for Shab-e-Barat festival. The court also removed restrictions on the number of people who can offer prayers there. Delhi Police had capped the number of people at each storey to 100.

305.title: Ram Charan extends monetary help to his security-in-charge in Ukraine
305.article_body: Actor Ram Charan has said that he contacted his security-in-charge, who is from Ukraine, after Russia began invading the country. "He was shaking as he spoke about the situation there. He also told me that his 85-year-old father has been walking around with a gun," Ram stated. Ram added the least he could do is to help him monetarily.

306.title: 17,000 Ukrainian refugees arrived in France amid war: Minister
306.article_body: French Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said on Wednesday that the country has accepted 17,000 refugees from Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion. Darmanin said that at the request of French President Emmanuel Macron, the interior ministry is working to host 1,00,000 Ukrainian refugees in France. According to UN, around three million people have left Ukraine amid the conflict.

307.title: Israel & Egypt to expand flights with new direct route: PM Bennett
307.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said on Wednesday that Israel and Egypt will expand flights between the countries with a new direct route from April onwards. The route will connect the Israeli city of Tel Aviv with Egypt's Sharm El-Sheikh. "Cooperation between the two countries is expanding in many areas, and this contributes to...the stability of the region," Bennett added.

308.title: Mann's swearing-in ceremony helps man reunite with family after 7 yrs
308.article_body: Twenty-six-year-old Jaswinder Singh who had left his house in Faridkot seven years ago was reunited with his family after he was found working with the tent contractor, hired for Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony. Singh's details were sent to Sadiq police station as he failed to furnish identity proof. Police approached his family for verification and he returned home.

309.title: SP supporter loses bike in poll bet, Akhilesh gives him gold chain
309.article_body: An SP supporter, Awadesh, lost his bike to a BJP supporter after losing a bet over UP Assembly poll results. He said SP chief and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav gave him a gold chain and asked him not to indulge in bets. "Had I won the bet, I would have gotten his (BJP supporter's) tempo (auto rickshaw)," Awadesh said.

310.title: Stalin congratulates Bhagwant Mann on taking oath as Punjab CM
310.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has congratulated Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Bhagwant Mann, who took oath as Punjab CM today. "Tamil Nadu & Punjab share a long history of being vocal about linguistic rights...Wishing...new government in Punjab a successful tenure," Stalin tweeted. Ceremony was held at Khatkar Kalan, ancestral village of Bhagat Singh, in presence of party supremo Arvind Kejriwal.

311.title: At 37.5°C, Pune sees highest day temperature this season so far
311.article_body: Pune's day temperature on Tuesday settled at 37.5°C, which is the highest for the city this season so far. Chinchwad's day temperature was 38.7°C, whereas Magarpatta saw a high of 38°C. India Meteorological Department said the day temperature is likely to remain around 37°C in Pune, while the night temperature will be between 14 to 21°C for next few days.

312.title: Ex-Fortis Healthcare Promoter Shivinder Singh's interim bail plea rejected by SC
312.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected former Fortis Healthcare Promoter Shivinder Singh's interim bail plea in a money laundering case, NDTV reported. Singh, who was arrested in December 2019, is accused of misappropriating ₹2,397 crore of Religare Finvest Limited's funds. Taking note of "serious allegations" and Singh being a "flight risk", SC rejected the interim bail plea.

313.title: Babar Azam breaks world record for highest score by a captain in 4th innings of a Test
313.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam has broken the world record for registering the highest score by a captain in the fourth innings of a Test match. The 27-year-old achieved the feat by scoring 196(425) against Australia in the second Test at Karachi. The previous record was held by ex-England captain Michael Atherton, who had scored 185*(492) against South Africa in 1995.

314.title: Except hijab all religious symbols will be allowed in schools: Owaisi
314.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that all religious symbols would now be permitted in educational institutions except the hijab. This comes after the Karnataka High Court upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions. Owaisi said that he disagrees with the high court's judgement and asked, "Will the court decide what an essential practice is...or religious scholars?"

315.title: Google Domains out of beta after 7 years
315.article_body: Google Domains, the technology giant's domain registration service, is losing its beta tag more than seven years after it first launched. "Today, we're moving Google Domains out of beta and into general availability in 26 countries," Google announced on Tuesday. "With more than 300 domain endings available, you can find a name that's right for your business," the company added.

316.title: Pune's BORI to hold online lectures on Maratha history from Mar 21
316.article_body: Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune will be organising an online lecture series on Maratha history from March 21 to April 2. The twelve-part series will cover topics, including India's pre-Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj political background, establishment of Swarajya, expansion of the Maratha empire, among others. It'll be jointly organised with the Bharat Itihas Sanshodhak Mandal.

317.title: Meta-worse for democracy: Rahul on 'Facebook charging BJP less' claim
317.article_body: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted "Meta-worse for democracy". Gandhi also shared reports by Al Jazeera and The Reporters' Collective, which claimed that Facebook had offered BJP cheaper deals for election advertisements than other parties. Congress president Sonia Gandhi asked the government to put an end to "Facebook's interference" in India's electoral politics.

318.title: PM congratulates Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, says 'will work together'
318.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated AAP leader Bhagwant Mann on taking oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab. PM Modi said, "Will work together for the growth of Punjab and welfare of the state's people." Mann took oath at Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh.

319.title: Was being harsh: Brian Cox on calling Johnny Depp 'overrated' actor
319.article_body: Actor Brian Cox said he regrets calling Johnny Depp an "overrated" actor. "I...thought I was being a bit harsh," he said. Brian added, "It's like, you go for the easy joke...I went for the easy joke. That was what happened." This comes after Brian stated he declined 'Pirates of the Caribbean' and called Depp overblown, overrated in his memoir.

320.title: 66 FDI proposals from neighbouring countries approved since Apr 2020: Govt
320.article_body: India has received 347 foreign direct investment (FDI) proposals from neighbouring countries since April 2020, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Som Parkash said. The total value of the proposals is about ₹75,951 crore. The highest number of approved proposals, at eight, were from the electronics sector, followed by the automobile and chemicals sectors at seven and five respectively.

321.title: IFS officer shares rainbow eucalyptus pics, says it's 'the world's most colourful tree'
321.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared pictures of rainbow eucalyptus and tweeted, "The rainbow eucalyptus is the only eucalyptus tree indigenous to the northern hemisphere and happens to be the most colourful tree in the world." He added that the rainbow effect is created as the bark peels off throughout each season and reveals "fresh, bright coloured bark below".

322.title: Give us time: SC on listing plea challenging HC's hijab order
322.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will consider listing an appeal challenging the Karnataka High Court's order upholding the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions. When senior advocate Sanjay Hegde sought urgent listing, SC said, "Give us time. We will see." The bench clarified it won't hear the matter on Monday when SC reopens after the Holi vacation.

323.title: 20 lakh kids in 12-14 age group eligible for COVID vaccination in K'taka
323.article_body: As COVID-19 vaccination for children aged between 12-14 years started in India, Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar flagged off the COVID-19 vaccination drive for the children in this age group at Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College in Bengaluru today. He said that about 20 lakh children in this age group are eligible for the vaccination in the state.

324.title: 7 consume liquor, assault forest official in Gurugram; 5 arrested
324.article_body: Police on Monday arrested five college students from Gurugram's Sultanpur National Park for allegedly assaulting a forest inspector of the state forest department after he asked them not to consume liquor. According to the police, seven suspects had arrived, out of which five were arrested, one escaped and another was admitted to the hospital for fracturing his leg while escaping.

325.title: I-T Dept recovers ₹20 crore cash in raids on Omaxe's offices: Reports
325.article_body: The Income Tax Department has recovered ₹20 crore in cash after conducting raids on various offices of realty firm Omaxe Limited, ANI reported. The department has also seized "accounts and sales documents which show more than ₹200 crore unaccounted transactions of the company". The raids, which started on Monday, are still underway at 38 out of 45 premises.

326.title: We don’t take such singles, it’s basic cricket: Veda on Deepti's run-out
326.article_body: Discussing India all-rounder Deepti Sharma's run-out in the 2022 Women's World Cup match against England, Veda Krishnamurthy said, "Even in domestic cricket, we don't take singles like that." "We generally say that this is basic cricket," added Veda. Deepti was dismissed for 0 off 10 deliveries. India were reduced to 28/3 after her dismissal.

327.title: B'luru's LILA Games raises $10 mn, PUBG-maker KRAFTON invests too
327.article_body: Bengaluru-based mobile game development studio LILA Games has raised $10 million in a Series A funding led by Rainfall Ventures. The round also saw participation from BITKRAFT Ventures, Galaxy Interactive, Sequoia Capital, and PUBG-maker KRAFTON. Founded by Joseph Kim, Paul Leydon, and Avinash Pandey, the gaming startup secured $2.8 million in its seed round in November 2020.

328.title: Markaz Nizamuddin mosque to reopen for Shab-e-Barat: Delhi Police
328.article_body: Delhi Police have permitted the reopening of the Markaz Nizamuddin mosque for prayers on the occasion of Shab-e-Barat, nearly two years after it was locked and public entry was prohibited. However, only less than 100 people will be allowed on each storey, as per the guidelines of the Delhi Disaster Management Authority. Entry will be allowed for fully vaccinated people.

329.title: 2 lakh trees illegally chopped down in Maha in 4 years: CM Uddhav Thackeray
329.article_body: Over two lakh trees were illegally cut down in Maharashtra in the last four years, said Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray who is also in charge of the state's forest department. "At least 48,893 criminal cases have been filed during this period, of which 1,435 are registered as serious offences," he said while informing the state legislative council on Wednesday.

330.title: CBI chargesheets ex-national auditor SK Sharma in ₹3,600cr AgustaWestland scam
330.article_body: CBI has filed a supplementary chargesheet in the ₹3,600-crore AgustaWestland scam against former national auditor Shashi Kant Sharma and four Indian Air Force personnel, officials said. The alleged scam is related to the purchase of 12 VVIP helicopters from AgustaWestland. Sharma was the Defence Secretary between 2011 and 2013 before being appointed the Comptroller and Auditor General.

331.title: Global COVID-19 cases rise for first time since January: WHO
331.article_body: The World Health Organisation (WHO) said global COVID-19 infections rose by 8% in the last week, reversing a decline in cases that first began in January this year. There were more than 11 million new COVID-19 infections last week and over 43,000 coronavirus-related deaths, WHO added. The number of COVID-19 deaths worldwide has been declining for the past three weeks.

332.title: Razorpay acquires Pune's IZealiant, marks its fifth acquisition
332.article_body: Fintech unicorn Razorpay has acquired Pune-based digital payments startup IZealiant Technologies for an undisclosed sum. As a part of the acquisition, Razorpay will absorb the entire team of IZealiant Technologies. This is Razorpay's fifth acquisition since its inception in 2014. Last month, it had acquired Malaysian fintech firm Curlec, marking its first international acquisition.

333.title: 2 missing mobile phones worth ₹45,000 traced by Hyd crime team
333.article_body: Station House Officer (SHO) of Hyderabad's Abid Road police station B Prasadha Rao informed that two missing mobile phones worth ₹45,000 were traced by the crime team and were handed over to the owners. In a similar incident, Rao tweeted on March 12, informing that three missing mobile phones worth ₹66,000 were traced and handed over to the complainants.

334.title: Govt planning to develop Indian road network as that of US by 2024: Gadkari
334.article_body: The government is planning to develop India's road network equivalent to that of the US by the end of 2024, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari informed Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. He further said that there is a need to create awareness about road safety as the number of road accidents is higher than number of people killed in war.

335.title: One child becoming a refugee every second in Ukraine due to war: UN
335.article_body: The United Nations on Wednesday said more than 1.5 million children have now fled Ukraine since the Russian invasion began on February 24. According to the latest "shocking" figures, "Every single minute, 55 children have fled their country. That is, a Ukrainian child has become a refugee almost every single second," UN children's agency (UNICEF) spokesperson James Elder said.

336.title: Latest rankings for Test bowlers released, Jasprit Bumrah jumps six spots
336.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test bowlers, with India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah jumping six spots to be ranked fourth. Ravichandran Ashwin is the top-ranked Indian bowler at the second position, while the rankings are led by Australia captain Pat Cummins. Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi dropped one place to be ranked fifth.

337.title: Netherlands will continue to supply weapons to Ukraine: Minister
337.article_body: Netherlands and other NATO countries will continue supplying weapons to Ukraine, even if those deliveries may become targets of Russian attacks, Dutch Defence Minister Kajsa Ollongren has said. "Ukraine has...right to defend itself, we'll continue to support it," she added. Her remarks come days after Russia attacked a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border, which is a member of NATO.

338.title: Father rapes 2 minor daughters for 2 yrs near Mumbai; arrested
338.article_body: Police arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly raping his two daughters, aged 12 and seven for two years in Boisar near Mumbai. The accused has been sexually assaulting his daughters on knifepoint ever since his wife died in March 2020. The girls shared their ordeal with activists of a tribal organisation, who helped them file a complaint against their father.

339.title: Shivangi Joshi recalls meeting Prabhas, says 'I'm a big fan of Baahubali'
339.article_body: Actress Shivangi Joshi, who played the role of Naira in the show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', recalls meeting actor Prabhas in 2019 and said she's a big-time 'Baahubali' fan. Speaking about Prabhas, Shivangi said he's very sweet. "It was really nice meeting him. I initially thought, 'What will he say', but he was very nice and humble," she added.

340.title: May not be possible for any director to think of story like RRR: Jr NTR
340.article_body: Telugu actor Jr NTR, when asked if he would have accepted 'RRR' with another director, said that it might not be possible for any director to think of a story like 'RRR'. "I can say that multi-starrer movies and crossover movies will continuously come from now onwards," he added. 'RRR', directed by SS Rajamouli, also features actor Ram Charan.

341.title: Wish I had kept the nose of my ancestors: Bella on getting nose job at 14
341.article_body: Model Bella Hadid said she regrets getting a nose operation done at the age of 14. "I wish I had kept the nose of my ancestors." Speaking about the comparisons made between her and sister-model Gigi Hadid, Bella said she always used to believe that she was the "uglier" sister because she wasn't as "cool" and "outgoing" as Gigi.

342.title: Russian journalist interrogated for 14 hrs after protesting war on state TV
342.article_body: The journalist, who interrupted a live state TV news bulletin to protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine, said she was interrogated for over 14 hours. "I wasn't allowed to get in touch with my family, friends. I was denied access to a lawyer," Marina Ovsyannikova said. Ovsyannikova had run into the news studio holding a sign saying, "No war".

343.title: Number of casual leaves for police officials increased from 12 to 20 in Maha
343.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Tuesday said the number of casual leaves (CLs) for police officials in the state has been increased from 12 to 20 per year. Police officials will also not be assigned night duty a day before their weekly off. The decision aims to offer comfort to them as their duty hours are long and hectic, government said.

344.title: Apple's biggest office evacuated after envelope with white powder found in US
344.article_body: Apple Park, the company's biggest campus in Cupertino, US, was partially evacuated on Tuesday after an envelope containing a white powder substance was discovered. The fire department's incident report showed there was a fire alarm and hazmat response at Apple's headquarters. Authorities concluded that there was no presence of hazardous materials and employees were allowed back inside.

345.title: Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth now 4 times higher than Paytm CEO's
345.article_body: India's richest self-made woman and Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth is now nearly four times higher than that of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, as per Forbes data. Sharma's fortune briefly fell below $1 billion on Wednesday, but currently stands at $1.1 billion. Meanwhile, Nayar's net worth stands at $4.9 billion. Both their companies went public in 2021.

346.title: Oscar-winning British filmmaker Steve McQueen receives knighthood
346.article_body: British filmmaker Steve McQueen received his knighthood at Windsor Castle on Tuesday. Princess Anne bestowed the knighthood upon McQueen instead of Queen Elizabeth II. McQueen's 2013 film '12 Years a Slave' is among his notable works and had won him an Oscar, BAFTA and a Golden Globe. In the UK, McQueen will be known as Sir Steve McQueen.

347.title: AAP was born because of their deceit during Anna Hazare’s agitation: Anil Vij
