347.article_body: The birth of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) took place because of the "deceit" they did during social activist Anna Hazare's agitation in Delhi, Haryana minister Anil Vij said on Wednesday. "People of Punjab have selected them, let's see if they are able to fulfil their promises in the coming years or they fail to do so," Vij added.

348.title: History-sheeter killed in encounter in Tirunelveli: Tamil Nadu Police
348.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police said they killed a history-sheeter, "Neeravi" Murugan, in an encounter. Murugan had about 60 cases, including murder, registered against him in Thoothukudi and Madurai, among other districts. A police officer opened fire on Murugan in self-defence when he attacked the police officials with sickles near Kalakadu, Tirunelveli Superintendent of Police, P Saravanan, said.

349.title: B'luru Police chief to hold Q&A session on FB to address people's issues
349.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has said that he'll hold a live question and answer session on Facebook with the city's residents on Saturday (March 19). He has asked people to share their grievances, ideas and suggestions with him using the hashtag #AskCPBlr on Bengaluru City Police's Facebook page. The session will be held from 11 am to 12 pm.

350.title: UN seeks nearly $4.3 billion aid to fight hunger in Yemen
350.article_body: The United Nations is seeking to raise nearly $4.3 billion to fight hunger in war-torn Yemen. According to the UN, over 1.7 crore people in the country need food assistance and this number could rise to 1.9 crore in the second half of 2022. It estimated that around 73 lakh people could face emergency levels of hunger by December.

351.title: Half-day leave for Assam govt employees to watch 'The Kashmir Files'
351.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said state government employees will get half-day leave to watch 'The Kashmir Files'. "They'll have to only inform their superior officers and submit the tickets the next day," he tweeted. Earlier, Sarma watched the movie with his cabinet and said he was moved by the portrayal of the plight of Kashmiri Pandits.

352.title: Intimate evening with friends: Anupam Mittal on pic with R Madhavan, Chetan Bhagat
352.article_body: Shark Tank India's judge Anupam Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture showing him hanging out with actor R Madhavan and author Chetan Bhagat. "An intimate evening with a few friends over the weekend made me feel that things are finally returning back to 'normal' after a long 2 years," Mittal wrote. "Hope I am right," he added.

353.title: 2022 will be among the 10 hottest years on record: Scientists
353.article_body: As per the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, 2022 had a baking-hot start and scientists are certain that this year is going to be among the top 10 hottest years on record. As per the global surface temperature recorded in January and February, 2022 was the sixth-hottest year. Moreover, there's 2.8% chance for 2022 to be the hottest year ever.

354.title: C'garh CM invites all MLAs to watch 'The Kashmir Files' in Raipur cinema hall
354.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has invited all MLAs in the state, including the opposition members, to watch 'The Kashmir Files' movie in a cinema hall in Raipur on Wednesday. "Tonight at 8 o'clock, all of the MLAs and invited citizens will watch the film together in a cinema hall in the capital," said Baghel in a tweet.

355.title: Shot few crucial scenes of RRR in Ukraine; in touch with crew there: Rajamouli
355.article_body: RRR director SS Rajamouli spoke about shooting a portion of his movie in Ukraine. He said, "We had gone there to shoot some crucial scenes. When we were shooting, I had no idea about the issues that have now escalated into a war." Rajamouli added that he's in touch with his crew there and has also enquired about their well-being.

356.title: Need assurance Medvedev doesn't support Putin: UK sports minister on Wimbledon
356.article_body: Talking about world number one men's tennis player, Russia's Daniil Medvedev featuring in this year's Wimbledon, UK Sports Minister Nigel Huddleston said, "We need...assurance [on him not being]...[a] supporter of Vladimir Putin." "People [won't] accept individuals...flying the Russian flag," added Huddleston. Medvedev will lose his number one ranking to Novak Djokovic on Monday (March 21).

357.title: Dhoni could give opportunity to younger guys: Jaffer on replacement for Chahar
357.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said CSK captain MS Dhoni could give opportunity to a younger pacer as a replacement for injured Deepak Chahar in the first few games of IPL 2022. "Dhoni could give confidence to uncapped guys...whether it's Tushar Deshpande, Simarjeet Singh or Mukesh Choudhary," stated Jaffer. Chahar got injured during the third T20I against West Indies.

358.title: 77 cr people covered under 'One Nation One Ration Card' scheme: Centre
358.article_body: Union Consumer Affairs Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday informed the Lok Sabha that as many as 77 crore people in the country have been covered under the 'One Nation One Ration Card' scheme. "The scheme is now available in 35 states and union territories," the minister said. The scheme allows nationwide portability of the ration card beneficiaries, he added.

359.title: Assam Police seize drugs worth ₹130 crore, 2 arrested
359.article_body: Assam Police arrested two youths after recovering drugs worth ₹130 crore from a truck on Wednesday. The accused were carrying drugs from Manipur to Assam when Assam Police's Crime Branch caught them at a toll gate. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma informed in a tweet, "4.6 lakh Yaba tablets, 12 kg Methamphetamine and 1.5 kg Heroin have been seized."

360.title: Vivek Agnihotri shares pic of threatening letter issued to Kashmiri Hindu family in 1990
360.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri has shared a picture of a threatening letter issued to a Kashmiri Hindu family in 1990. "Thank you @PMOIndia @narendramodi ji for reminding everyone about India's greatest value - The Truth. This is the TRUTH of Kashmir. If someone disputes this, I can present thousands of original documents like this," Agnihotri tweeted.

361.title: Anti-Hindu phobias also emerging: India on UN's 'Int'l Day to Combat Islamophobia'
361.article_body: As UNGA adopted resolution to proclaim March 15 as 'International Day to Combat Islamophobia', India expressed concern at the elevation of the phobia against one religion to such a level while excluding others. "Religiophobias have...affected the followers of non-Abrahamic religions as well. This have contributed to the emergence of...anti-Hindu, anti-Buddhist and anti-Sikh phobias," India said.

362.title: Practiced having gag in my mouth, consulted trauma expert: Amaara on 'Rudra..'
362.article_body: Amaara Sangam said that she consulted trauma expert to prepare for her role in 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness'. "I studied trauma responses and the physicality of it. I had to scream and project with gag in my mouth so I practiced having it in my mouth. In the process of preparation, I learned a lot about trauma," she added.

363.title: UP govt to invoke NSA against those helping students cheat in board exams
363.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has directed officials to invoke the National Security Act against those found helping students to cheat in Classes 10th and 12th state board examinations. Officials said a control room has been set up in Lucknow to monitor the examination centres. Over 51 lakh students will reportedly appear in the board examinations, which will start from March 24.

364.title: Looking forward to playing with Ashwin: RR's 20-yr-old Riyan Parag
364.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who was bought back by the franchise for ₹3.8 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's looking forward to playing alongside off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin in the upcoming IPL season. "I think I can pick his brains on the varieties and all the mysteries," Riyan stated. RR bought Ashwin for ₹5 crore in the auction.

365.title: Rahul, I share a great bond despite competing for the same spot: Mayank
365.article_body: Opener Mayank Agarwal said he shares a "great" bond with KL Rahul who is a fellow opener, despite "probably" competing for the same spot. Mayank added that Virat Kohli asked him to lift the trophy after India won their first-ever Test series in Australia in 2018-19. The opener made his Test debut in that historic 2018-19 series.

366.title: Bio-bubble should be done away with, becoming a laughing stock: Arun Lal
366.article_body: Sharing his opinion on bio-bubbles, ex-India cricketer Arun Lal said, "The bio-bubble should be done away with...It's becoming a laughing stock now. Children are going to school physically while we're trapped inside bio-bubbles." "It makes no sense," added the Bengal Ranji coach. "Yes, it was necessary at one stage," stated the former India cricketer.

367.title: Ruckus at Noida theatre after 'The Kashmir Files' paused briefly
367.article_body: The screening of 'The Kashmir Files' at a multiplex in Noida was paused briefly, following which people protested and a police team also reached the spot to pacify them. Police said there was a glitch in the central air conditioning system due to which the movie was paused. However, it was fixed immediately and the film show resumed soon.

368.title: Marriage with Dany not working out was the best thing in many ways: Dwayne
368.article_body: Wrestler-turned-actor Dwayne Johnson said his marriage with ex-wife Dany Garcia not working out was the "best thing" in so many ways. "It allowed her to meet the love of her life and me to meet the love of my life," added Dwayne. "The stuff you thought was important that you should sweat maybe...15 years ago [is] so meaningless," he stated.

369.title: EU plans to buy polio, COVID vaccines for Ukraine refugees: Official
369.article_body: European Union (EU) plans to procure and distribute vaccines of measles, polio, tuberculosis and COVID-19 among refugees from Ukraine, EU Health Commissioner Stella Kyriakides said on Tuesday. "Vaccination coverage in Ukraine was very low for several...preventable diseases, especially for children," Kyriakides added. About 35% Ukrainians are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, according to WHO.

370.title: Repair roads in 15 days: HC to BBMP after death due to pothole in B'luru
370.article_body: Karnataka High Court has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to conduct a three-day survey of potholes in Central Business District of Bangalore (CBD) and repair them within 15 days of the recent pothole accident. On Sunday night, a 27-year-old techie died by falling into a pothole. Demanding immediate action, HC said it feels "guilty and sorry" about the accident.

371.title: 2 cheat 100 people of ₹10 cr by promising govt jobs in Hyd; arrested
371.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly cheating over 100 people of about ₹10 crore by promising them jobs in the Food Corporation of India and Railways in Secunderabad. Rachakonda Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat said the prime accused was into liaison work and railway contracts in Delhi. He had allegedly cheated several people in various states, including Delhi and Telangana.

372.title: Kapil hits gym at 4 am, fan says 'After effects of shooting with Akshay'
372.article_body: Kapil Sharma took to Instagram to share a video of himself working out, with the caption reading, "When you have a 6 am shift, check in to the gym by 4 am." Reacting to the post, an Instagram user commented, "It's just after [effects] of shooting with Akshay Kumar." Akshay promoted his film 'Bachchhan Paandey' on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'.

373.title: Bihar Class 12th Board results out, 80.15% students clear exams
373.article_body: The results of Class 12 exams for the Bihar School Examination Board were declared on Wednesday and 80.15% of students cleared the exams. The exams for science, commerce and arts streams were conducted between February 1 and February 14. It has been announced that toppers of each stream will get ₹1 lakh cash, a laptop and Kindle eBook reader.

374.title: Considered wearing prosthetics to play dad's part: Ranbir on Sharmaji Namkeen
374.article_body: In a video message ahead of the film's trailer release, actor Ranbir Kapoor talks about his father Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen' and recalls how after the latter's death, they considered all options available to finish the film. He said, "We thought of trying VFX or I could wear prosthetics...But nothing was working out...And that's when...Paresh Rawal stepped in."

375.title: IPL came 2-3 years late in careers of icon players: Saba Karim
375.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim has said Sachin Tendulkar, VVS Laxman, Sourav Ganguly and Rahul Dravid would've benefitted if the IPL had started earlier. "IPL came 2-3 years late in the careers of icon players...they tried...[but] it was the last leg of their careers, it took time to adjust to T20s," he added. Tendulkar played 78 IPL games, scoring 2334 runs.

376.title: My wife is the genius behind this: RR's Hetmyer on sporting pink hair
376.article_body: Answering a question from a fan about him sporting pink hair after joining Rajasthan Royals, West Indies batsman Shimron Hetmyer said, "My wife is the...genius behind the whole thing." Hetmyer named SRH skipper Kane Williamson as his all-time favourite cricketer. "I should be able to score above 20 runs in nets against Yuzvendra Chahal," added Hetmyer.

377.title: Man sentenced to death for raping, killing 5-yr-old niece 8 years ago in UP
377.article_body: Special judge of POCSO court has awarded a man, Mohd Asif Khan, death sentence for raping and killing his five-year-old niece eight years ago. FIR in case said that the girl had gone missing. From evidence of witnesses, court found girl was last seen having ice-cream with Khan. The matter has been referred to High Court for confirmation of penalty.

378.title: COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia: ADB
378.article_body: Lockdowns imposed due to the COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia, Asian Development Bank (ADB) said in a report. The job losses pushed 47 lakh people to extreme poverty last year as inequality widened and movement restrictions hit retail and informal sectors the hardest. "The pandemic's impact on poverty and unemployment will likely persist," ADB said.

379.title: Latest rankings for Test batters out, Virat Kohli slips 4 spots to 9th
379.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters, with Virat Kohli slipping four spots to be ranked ninth. Further, Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne jumped three spots to be ranked fifth. India captain Rohit Sharma is the highest ranked Indian in the rankings at sixth position. Rishabh Pant is ranked tenth.

380.title: US startup whose robots serve food in restaurants raises $81 mn
380.article_body: US-based Bear Robotics, whose robots are used in several restaurants to serve customers, has raised $81 million in a Series B funding round. The funding saw participation from Cleveland Avenue, a VC firm founded by a former McDonald's chief executive. Bear Robotics claims its Servi robots have delivered 28 million meals so far.

381.title: SC to hear Amazon's plea for protection of Future Retail's assets on Mar 23
381.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear Amazon's application seeking relief against the alienation of Future Retail's assets on March 23. Amazon filed the plea after Reliance Industries began taking control of Future Retail's stores across India. The court proposed that Amazon can press for relief during proceedings before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre-governed tribunal.

382.title: Parked Delhi Capitals team bus attacked in Mumbai, 5 arrested
382.article_body: A parked Delhi Capitals team bus was attacked by miscreants in Mumbai on Tuesday. The Colaba Police have arrested five people following the incident, including Maharashtra Navnirman Sena's transport wing vice president Prashant Gandhi. The miscreants allegedly attacked the bus to protest against authorities for giving contract for IPL buses to a company based out of Delhi.

383.title: Who is Rosa Bonheur, the painter honoured by today's Google Doodle?
383.article_body: Google Doodle on Wednesday marked the 200th birth anniversary of Rosa Bonheur, the French painter whose career inspired a future generation of women in arts. Her reputation as an animal painter and sculptor grew in the 1840s, with her works exhibited at the prestigious Paris Salon from 1841-1853. In 1853, she garnered international acclaim with her painting 'The Horse Fair'.

384.title: Chinese stocks jump the most since 2008 after $1.5 tn wiped out in two days
384.article_body: Stocks across Hong Kong and China witnessed a massive rally after China's state council vowed to keep its stock market stable following a $1.5-trillion wipeout over the past two sessions. The Hang Seng China Enterprises Index jumped 13% on Wednesday, its biggest gain since the global financial crisis of 2008. Chinese technology firms including Alibaba and Tencent gained over 23%.

385.title: Pics show 214-million-year-old geological structure on Earth formed by meteorite
385.article_body: Astronaut Kayla Barron, who's currently aboard ISS, shared photos of a 214-million-year old geological structure on Earth. "The Manicouagan Reservoir and René-Levasseur Island always catch my eye during passes over Quebec," she wrote. "This...geological structure was formed...by a meteorite that scientists estimate was about 5 km in diameter and struck the earth at...17 km/s," Barron added.

386.title: Woman entrepreneur dies by suicide in balcony after cancer diagnosis in Karnataka
386.article_body: Female entrepreneur Suma Sathish, who was reportedly the owner of a textile company, allegedly died by suicide in the balcony of her home in Karnataka's Mangaluru in the early hours of Tuesday. Police said she allegedly took the step after being diagnosed with cancer. A case has been registered at Barke Police station.

387.title: Sensex jumps 1,040 points to end at 56,817; Nifty above 16,900
387.article_body: The Indian benchmark indices recouped the previous day's losses to end in the green on Wednesday amid positive global cues. The Sensex jumped nearly 1,040 points to close at 56,817, while the broader Nifty 50 also surged 312 points to end at 16,975. Ultratech Cement and Axis Bank were among top Sensex gainers, while Paytm ended 7% higher.

388.title: UP CM Yogi visits booths as COVID vaccination of 12-14 age group starts
388.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday visited a vaccination booth in Lucknow as COVID-19 vaccination of children in the 12-14 age group started in the country. CM Yogi said that over 84 lakh children will be given a "protective shield" under this vaccination drive. He added, "We need to be cautious as experts are predicting fourth wave of COVID-19."

389.title: Over 8,000 kids aged under 5 died in Maha in Feb-Aug 2021: Govt
389.article_body: Maharashtra Women and Child Development Minister Yashomati Thakur said over 8,000 children aged under five died in February-August 2021 during the COVID-19 pandemic. While emphasising that the state didn't neglect pregnant women, lactating mothers, malnourished and ailing children, Thakur said industrial and economically strong districts reported more deaths. Nagpur reported most deaths at 923.

390.title: Pune civic body announces drive against illegal encroachments
390.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced a drive against illegal encroachments across the city. PMC will remove illegal structures blocking the city roads but promises rehabilitation for authorised hawkers to other designated spots, Deputy PMC Commissioner Madhav Jagtap said. Action against those putting up illegal flex banners and flags will be taken, Jagtap added.

391.title: Man kills girlfriend's father for refusing his marriage proposal in Thane
391.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested by Thane Police on March 13 for allegedly murdering the father of his girlfriend for denying his marriage request. After the victim, Kamaljit Sande, denied the proposal, the accused, Pappukumar Shah, assured him he would respect his wish. However, on March 4, Shah took Sande out for a party and slit his throat.

392.title: Man accused of gangraping 16-yr-old girl & filming the act shot dead in Assam encounter
392.article_body: The prime accused in the case involving gangraping and filming a 16-year-old girl in Assam was shot dead in a police encounter when he allegedly tried to escape from custody after attacking a police team. Guwahati Medical College Hospital superintendent Abhijit Sarma said the accused, Biki Ali, sustained four injury marks, one in the chest and three in the back.

393.title: Joe Biden mistakenly calls Kamala Harris 'First Lady of the US'
393.article_body: US President Joe Biden mistakenly called Vice President Kamala Harris the "First Lady of the US" at an event. Biden made the gaffe when he was explaining that Harris would not attend the event because her husband, Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff, had contracted COVID-19. "I'm Joe Biden. I'm Jill Biden's husband and proud of it," Biden later joked.

394.title: Didn't want to do Saazish; hoped Saira would say no but she agreed: Dharmendra
394.article_body: Dharmendra shared a song from his and Saira Banu's 1975 film 'Saazish'. He said he didn't want to do the movie and hoped Saira would say no to the film but she agreed. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "I asked the producer to go and sign Saira, [it was] difficult to sign her those days. But Saira happily agreed."

395.title: Pune airport to get new terminal building at ₹475 cr by August 2023
395.article_body: The Pune airport is expected to get a new terminal building with enhanced capacity by August 2023. The construction work has been undertaken by the Airports Authority of India at a cost of ₹475 crore. The new and old terminal will have a passenger handling capacity of 1.6 crore passengers per annum.

396.title: Honest probe will identify culprits: Farooq on 'The Kashmir Files'
396.article_body: Reacting to the movie 'The Kashmir Files', ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said that an honest investigation should be held to find out the culprits and the reason why such an incident occurred in the valley. He said, "Every film portrays...story in a unique way...It's important...the film portrays exact truth." The movie depicts the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the valley.

397.title: Fan comes up with 'Bachchhan Paandey' themed Holi colours, pics surface
397.article_body: A gulaal manufacturer from Lucknow, who is also a fan of actor Akshay Kumar, has come up with a "special edition" of Holi colours based on the film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. The packets of gulaal have a picture of Akshay from the movie with "Holi Ke Rang, Bachchhan Paandey ke sang" written on them. Holi will be celebrated on March 18.

398.title: Man claims hijab-wearing wife denied train seat, Mumbai Police chief says, 'Ridiculous'
398.article_body: A man, Dr Parvez Mandviwala, tweeted on Wednesday that his wife was denied a seat on a local train in Mumbai as she was wearing a hijab. Replying to the news report, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey tweeted, "This is ridiculous." Mandviwala claimed few passengers insisted that saree-clad women get seated despite the fact that her wife carried their infant.

399.title: A proud moment: Viswanathan Anand on Chennai hosting 44th Chess Olympiad
399.article_body: Five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said it's a proud moment for all Indians that Chennai has been chosen to host the 44th Chess Olympiad. The Olympiad was scheduled to take place in Moscow but was shifted amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Chennai warmly welcomes all Kings and Queens from around the world!" tweeted Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin.

400.title: Pune to host conclave on alternate fuel from April 2
400.article_body: Pune will host an alternate fuel conclave from April 2 to April 5, Maharashtra government has announced. The 'Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave' is in line with the state government's policy towards accelerated adoption of e-vehicles, which government announced in 2021. "We need to act now to preserve our environment. New mobility is...very important," state Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said.

401.title: Punjab di aan, baan, shaan: AAP after Bhagwant Mann takes oath as CM
401.article_body: After Bhagwant Mann took oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on Wednesday, the AAP described him as "Punjab di aan, baan aur shaan". The swearing-in ceremony was held at  Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of Bhagat Singh. The AAP supporters wore 'basanti' turbans and dupattas at the ceremony.
